results.name: protocol.valid_bacnet
results.expected_behavior: BACnet traffic can be seen on the network and packets are valid and not malformed

results.name: protocol.bacnet.version
results.expected_behavior: The BACnet client implements an up to date version of BACnet

results.name: protocol.valid_modbus
results.description:
Established connection to modbus port: 502
Holding registers succesfully read: 0:5
Input registers succesfully read: 0:5
Coil registers succesfully read: 0:1
Discrete inputs succesfully read: 0:1
results.expected_behavior: Any Modbus functionality works as expected and valid Modbus traffic can be observed

results.name: security.tls.v1_2_server
results.description:
TLS 1.2 validated: Certificate has a valid time range
RSA key length passed: 2048 >= 2048
Device signed by cert:/testrun/root_certs/myrootca4132.pem
TLS 1.3 validated: Certificate has a valid time range
RSA key length passed: 2048 >= 2048
Device signed by cert:/testrun/root_certs/myrootca4132.pem
results.expected_behavior: TLS 1.2 certificate is issued to the web browser client when accessed

results.name: security.tls.v1_2_client
results.expected_behavior: The packet indicates a TLS connection with at least TLS 1.2 and support for ECDH and ECDSA ciphers

results.name: connection.switch.arp_inspection
results.expected_behavior: Device continues to operate correctly when ARP inspection is enabled on the switch.  No functionality is lost with ARP inspection enabled.

results.name: connection.switch.dhcp_snooping
results.description: Device does not act as a DHCP server
results.expected_behavior: Device continues to operate correctly when DHCP snooping is enabled on the switch.

results.name: connection.dhcp_address
results.description: Device responded to leased ip address
results.expected_behavior: The device is not setup with a static IP address.  The device accepts an IP address from a DHCP server (RFC 2131) and responds succesfully to an ICMP echo (ping) request.

results.name: connection.mac_address
results.expected_behavior: N/A

results.name: connection.mac_oui
results.expected_behavior: The MAC address prefix is registered in the IEEE Organizationally Unique Identifier database.

results.name: connection.private_address
results.expected_behavior: The device under test accepts IP addresses within all ranges specified in RFC 1918 and communicates using these addresses.  The Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA) has reserved the following three blocks of the IP address space for private internets.  10.0.0.0 - 10.255.255.255.255 (10/8 prefix). 172.16.0.0 - 172.31.255.255 (172.16/12 prefix).  192.168.0.0 - 192.168.255.255 (192.168/16 prefix)

results.name: connection.shared_address
results.expected_behavior: The device under test accepts IP addresses within the ranges specified in RFC 6598 and communicates using these addresses

results.name: connection.single_ip
results.description: Device is using a single IP address
results.expected_behavior: The device under test does not behave as a network switch and only requets one IP address.  This test is to avoid that devices implement network switches that allow connecting strings of daisy chained devices to one single network port, as this would not make 802.1x port based authentication possible.

results.name: connection.target_ping
results.expected_behavior: The device under test responds to an ICMP echo (ping) request.

results.name: connection.ipaddr.ip_change
results.description: Device has accepted an IP address change
results.expected_behavior: If the lease expires before the client receiveds a DHCPACK, the client moves to INIT state, MUST immediately stop any other network processing and requires network initialization parameters as if the client were uninitialized.  If the client then receives a DHCPACK allocating the client its previous network addres, the client SHOULD continue network processing.  If the client is given a new network address, it MUST NOT continue using the previous network address and SHOULD notify the local users of the problem.

results.name: connection.ipaddr.dhcp_failover
results.description: Secondary DHCP server lease confirmed active in device

results.name: connection.ipv6_slaac
results.description: Device has formed SLAAC address fd10:77be:4186:0:1a62:e4ff:fed7:430a
results.expected_behavior: The device under test complies with RFC4862 and forms a valid IPv6 SLAAC address

results.name: connection.ipv6_ping
results.description: Device responds to IPv6 ping on fd10:77be:4186:0:1a62:e4ff:fed7:430a
results.expected_behavior: The device responds to the ping as per RFC4443

results.name: dns.network.hostname_resolution
results.expected_behavior: The device sends DNS requests.

results.name: dns.network.from_dhcp
results.description: DNS traffic detected only to DHCP provided server
results.expected_behavior: The device sends DNS requests to the DNS server provided by the DHCP server

results.name: security.services.ftp
results.expected_behavior: There is no FTP service running on any port

results.name: security.ssh.version
results.expected_behavior: SSH server is not running or server is SSHv2

results.name: security.services.telnet
results.expected_behavior: There is no Telnet service running on any port

results.name: security.services.smtp
results.expected_behavior: There is no SMTP service running on any port

results.name: security.services.http
results.expected_behavior: Device is unreachable on port 80 (or any other port) and only responds to HTTPS requests on port 443 (or any other port if HTTP is used at all)

results.name: security.services.pop
results.expected_behavior: There is no POP service running on any port

results.name: security.services.imap
results.expected_behavior: There is no IMAP service running on any port

results.name: security.services.snmpv3
results.expected_behavior: Device is unreachable on port 161 (or any other port) and device is unreachable on port 162 (or any other port) unless SNMP is essential in which case it is SNMPv3 is used.

results.name: security.services.vnc
results.expected_behavior: Device cannot be accessed / connected to via VNC on any port

results.name: security.services.tftp
results.expected_behavior: There is no TFTP service running on any port

results.name: ntp.network.ntp_server
results.expected_behavior: The device does not respond to NTP requests when it's IP is set as the NTP server on another device

results.name: ntp.network.ntp_support
results.expected_behavior: The device sends an NTPv4 request to the configured NTP server.

results.name: ntp.network.ntp_dhcp
results.description: Device sent NTP request to non-DHCP provided server
results.expected_behavior: Device can accept NTP server address, provided by the DHCP server (DHCP OFFER PACKET)
